channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Calls India a Friend, but Is Trying to Block Its Imports
item.description: Stunned to see their own exports punished harshly, Indians are picking through the wreckage for signs of hope. There’s some but not a lot.

item.title: The stock market is crashing: Here’s what financial experts say you should do now
item.description: 'Resist the urge to shift out of stocks entirely.'

item.title: Robust March jobs report signals the economy is starting from a ‘position of strength’ if Trump tariffs spark downturn
item.description: In March, the U.S. added 228,000 jobs, while the unemployment rate ticked up to 4.2%.

item.title: Wharton’s Jeremy Siegel calls Trump’s tariffs the ‘biggest policy mistake in 95 years’
item.description: “I don’t know why Trump didn’t learn the lesson of the Smoot-Hawley tariff,” he said.

item.title: Something Else for Europe and the U.S. to Disagree About: ‘Free Speech’
item.description: The two have long been divided on whether speech can be restricted, and when. Under the Trump administration, the gap is widening.

item.title: U.S. Employers Added 228,000 Jobs in March, but Outlook Is Clouded
item.description: The gain was stronger than expected, though the impact of President Trump’s tariffs and other policies on the labor market has yet to play out.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs are not ‘common sense’—and they’re putting America’s credibility and ‘exorbitant privilege’ at risk
item.description: The tariffs, which are taxes on international transactions, are destroying trillions in U.S. wealth, with the worst still to come.

item.title: What One Image Shows About a Strike in Gaza
item.description: What one image shows about the aftermath of a strike on a shelter in Gaza.

item.title: Trump planned to import eggs to lower prices for consumers. Then came ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs
item.description: That omelet won't be getting much cheaper.

item.title: Storm Stalled Over Central U.S. Brings Another Day of Rain and Flooding
item.description: Communities from Arkansas to Michigan were on high alert for more potentially dangerous flooding as the storm, which has killed seven, drenched the re...

item.title: What One Image Shows About a Strike in Gaza
item.description: What one image shows about the aftermath of a strike on a shelter in Gaza.

item.title: Garbage Strike in UK’s Second Largest City Leaves Trash Piled High
item.description: A standoff between garbage collectors and municipal officials in Britain’s second largest city has left an estimated 17,000 tons of trash on the stree...

item.title: Rubio Warns Russia that U.S. Patience on Ukraine War Is Running Out
item.description: Whether the Kremlin is serious about peace talks to end the Ukraine war will become clear soon, the secretary of state said.

item.title: Something Else for Europe and the U.S. to Disagree About: ‘Free Speech’
item.description: The two have long been divided on whether speech can be restricted, and when. Under the Trump administration, the gap is widening.

item.title: Trump Weighs In on Marine Le Pen Conviction
item.description: The American president cast the French politician’s conviction as an example of far-right persecution, ignoring ample evidence against her.
